message: Leo tends to drag them out pretty long sometimes.  I don't mind 2 mins, but sometimes they can drag on for 5 mins or more.
I don't mind the ads. Due to the informal style of the shows the ads often feel more like part of a conversation rather than an ad.
They do work - I typically use two or three of his sponsors
yea but leo is lengthy on every thing. Plus he is producing the show at the same time
I don't mind them. At least they are about things we may be interested in.
except for audible ads, i usually just take a break as well,.. grab a drink, bathroom, etc.
but given the length of the shows the commercials are still a much lower percentage than main-stream media.
the commercials don't bother me...as long as the conversations are high brow and informative I'm cool with them.
@lessfeet I totally agree...I have no complaints.
Don't watch live, skip them - or mute the sound when they come on (can be a bit grating to hear the same thing for the 9999 time)
I have no probs with commercials after all they allow Leo to keep this going I was so sad when tech tv went away.

I don't mind the Commercials. The fact the they tend to be a little impromptu, sure works out better than watching the same identical commercials over and over again.  As others have said, Audible usually come off as a segment of show.  At least I don't have to listen to a pre-canned one over and over again.
Actually I like the way he does ads. If it's something on the radio, then it's the same dang ad over and over again. But with live ads then Its something different, and usually less repetative.
If you watch a lot of twit they get long and repetitive but I don't mind, twit is free
I have signed up for many of his sponsors.  I kinda like hearing what's so great about them again. It makes me feel smart.
I don't mind them too much - the hosts usually do them in such a way that they feel like a part of the show. I agree with @unwrangle, the Audible ones tend to be my favorite.
As ads go, these are some of the least intrusive out there. And typically pretty relevant.

CAUTION: Audible.com is addicting!  I "tried" Audible through Leo's FREE offer over a year ago, and I've been hooked every since.  I think Leo should have to disclose that once you "try" audible you will end up becoming a monthly subscriber.  :)
I think that some of the shows should end at 1 hour or 1.5 hours at most but the commercial length is fine...
I hate the ads at the beginning and they are hard to skip

We agree that in general the ads are relevant to the audience, are made conversational (Leo, mostly; the newbies could get a little more conversational). We were discussing that, too. We think that maybe also, IF TWiT was making more money for the longer, causal/conversational reads, than more power to Leo for that. But, if it just a stylistic reading difference (leo ,the consumate professional radio guy vs. the still getting better everyone elses, with the exception of The Home Theater Geek guy), we think, yes, more than two or three minutes is rather silly. Unless of course the ad is for Audible, which usually benefits as a better ad when we hear some audio samples from the site - in their case hearing samples is really the deal breaker for anyone buying into Audible as a book choice.
@CLCRADIO WHO IS "we"?????

One thing, too. We are going to soon be users of hover and squarespace/redirect - so, the ads do work! Frankly, the ONLY place we have ever heard of either was soley from TWiT ads - most of our techy DJs/TJs don't listen to enough Rev3 to have to hear canned ads. (hehe)

Who is this Rev3 you speak of? lol, jk. I personally love the audible ads, as they feel like a book club only with really intelligent people, not just Oprah and her clones. Also, watching Brian do commercials is hilarious on NSFW. This last weeks episodehad me me laughingso hard my family thought I had a heart attack.
Bottom line is commercials make TWiT possable. I for one thank the sponcors.
@lessfeet Not the point of this thread

Yeah, the point me starting this thread isn't that I don't like the ads, and I agree they definitely work because I also use audible, hover, squarespace, I have a drobo, and etc.  I just think 'sometimes' Leo can really drag them out too long.
I baste my turkey during the ads
They are long. I guess they want to make it hard for people to FFWD through them.

I think it is the the point. It's a free service but it has to be payed for and if they want to ramble on for even longer I for one will not be complaining. At least you don't have to hear Depends ads!
It isn't. He knows the point of the commercials, and still think they are too long sometimes.
I don't like the jewelry or weight-loss drink ads

Wow, are we really dissecting this? @lessfeet, it isn't the point. Ads will be there regardless. As per this topic title, the question is how long of an ad is too long? for OP 2 mins of ad tops... for me, 5 min is threading the line... maybe you don't mind 15 mins ad?
@richardya I've never heard a wight loss add and the jewelry adds are at least related to tech.
TV ads are usually 30 seconds or less. Most web video ads are even shorter. I make a living on advertising too, but 2 minute, 5 minute, and longer ads are over the line.

@chartier yes, but the total ads to content ratio is the question and Leo's ads still seem to be a much lower total percentage wise. For example a 60 minute TV show has 20 minutes of commercials and with Leo a two hour podcast has less than 20.
This discussion is boring me!
@craigshipp Depends on where you are. Some places a 60 minute show actually lats 60 minutes. Perhaps the OP is from a place in the world where the stations are not so greedy ;)
@chartier TV ads are usually 60 seconds, rarely 30 seconds these days.
@jsarbour CLCRADIO is an Netcasting station!!!!!!!!, and polling 7 DJs??????? That's the "we" !!!!!!!!!
@PCMDME Naw. JuRy is the one who makes those fun (to me) Brian just plays the straight man in that Vaudvillian act!.

@unwrangle Kind of agree there, they shouldn't be longer than 3 minutes. Audible: the exception, they almost need to be longer than 3 minutes.But squarespace? longer than 2 minutes is too long for them or Hover.com
@CLCRADIO Me being TJ Dan.
That said, Leo and Loic Le Meu 'playing' Virtua Tennis on TWiT is the kind of content you usually don't get *g*

@CLRADIO, Its true that Justin does do great ads. I referred, however, to the SquareSpace ad of a particular episode, in which Brian told of a dream in which he has sex with a male skeleton. They had a site within minutes called Gay Sex Skeletons or some such. All Brian that episode. His moments may be rare, but he keeps up with Justin's zany shows.
Lets not forget how fast grabrubarf came up
Yes. That is why I PVR my shows.

imo, the sponsor ads are just right. Leo is very selective about which companies he'll accept and I enjoy the live reads.  For instance, the Audible ad typically comes with a quality book recommendation.  I know nothing about gay sex skeletons.  lol
